intro: Brachycarpaea flava, commonly known as the yellow brachycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive, peppery scent when crushed. Brachycarpaea flava is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
